wxMySQL Class Reference

#include <wxMySQL.h>

bool Connect (wxString hostname, int port, wxString username, wxString password, wxString dbname="")

Detailed Description

Provides the connection to MySQL server.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

wxMySQL::wxMySQL (  wxString  hostname,
int  port,
wxString  username,
wxString  password,
wxString  dbname = ""
) 
 

Parametrized constructor.

See also:
wxMySQL()
Parameters:
hostname contains the host name of the machine with installed MySQL server. The value of hostname parameter may be either a hostname or an IP address. If hostname is NULL or the string "localhost", a connection to the local host is assumed. If the OS supports sockets (Unix) or named pipes (Windows), they are used instead of TCP/IP to connect to the server.
port contains the port for MySQL connection. If port is not 0, the value will be used as the port number for the TCP/IP connection.
username contains the user's MySQL login ID. If username is NULL or the empty string "", the current user is assumed. Under Unix, this is the current login name. Under Windows ODBC, the current username must be specified explicitly.
password contains the password for user. If password is NULL, only entries in the user table for the user that have a blank (empty) password field will be checked for a match.
dbname is the database name. If dbname is not NULL, the connection will set the default database to this value.

Member Function Documentation

bool wxMySQL::Connect (  wxString  hostname,
int  port,
wxString  username,
wxString  password,
wxString  dbname = ""
) 
 

Opens MySQL connection.

Parameters:
hostname contains the host name of the machine with installed MySQL server. The value of hostname parameter may be either a hostname or an IP address. If hostname is NULL or the string "localhost", a connection to the local host is assumed. If the OS supports sockets (Unix) or named pipes (Windows), they are used instead of TCP/IP to connect to the server.
port contains the port for MySQL connection. If port is not 0, the value will be used as the port number for the TCP/IP connection.
username contains the user's MySQL login ID. If username is NULL or the empty string "", the current user is assumed. Under Unix, this is the current login name. Under Windows ODBC, the current username must be specified explicitly.
password contains the password for user. If password is NULL, only entries in the user table for the user that have a blank (empty) password field will be checked for a match.
dbname is the database name. If dbname is not NULL, the connection will set the default database to this value.
